intro: Anthospermum burkei, commonly known as the red sandalwood, is a small shrub native to Madagascar. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant produces small, dark blue to black berries that are typically edible. It thrives in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to the arid conditions of its native environment. Due to its unique appearance and ecological significance, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
